result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan D. Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: each other and to the misdemeanor count

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan D. Harris

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on November 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:21 p.m.
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CF852 and 22CM459

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence and DOC Agent; Defendant appears in person, pro se.

Date and time set for a Probation Review Hearing. VRCW.

COURT questions defendant if he has received a copy of the probation review; Defendant in receipt of report and reviewed same;
COURT questions defendant regarding assessment. 
Defendant makes statement.
Agent makes statement. 

NEXT DATE:  PRH - 11/11/22 at 1:15 p.m.

Adj: 1:26 p.m.
Hard copy has been signed by Judge
Granting return of bond money to surety
Surety's request to return posted bond money to him
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

3:10 p.m.
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CF852 and 22CM459

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person with Attorney Thomas Roley.

22CF852:
Waiver of Prelim. filed; COURT questions deft as to waiver.
COURT finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information will be e-filed; Reading Waived; R/J.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to:
22CF852
COUNT 1: Possess Firearm - Convicted of a Felony, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 4 Possession of THC, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 5: Possess Drug Paraphernalia, Repeater >> DRI.
COUNT 6: Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor, Repeater >> DRI.

22CM459
COUNT 1: Battery, Repeater, Domestic Abuse >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.
PLEA to: 
22CF852
COUNT 2: Possess Firearm - Convicted of a Felony, Repeater >> NO CONTEST. 
COUNT 3: Possession of Methamphetamine, Repeater >> NO CONTEST. 

22CM459
COUNT 2: Disorderly Conduct, Repeater, Domestic Abuse >> NO CONTEST. 

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 
On 22CF852 - Counts 2 and 3: SWH for 3 years probation (to run concurrent to each other/and to the misdemeanor count); CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; SAFE Program; CC; and DNA sample and surcharge. 7 days jail credit if revoked. 

On 22CM459 - Count 2: SWH for 1 year probation (to run concurrent to the felony counts); CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; SAFE Program; N/C with victim unless approved by agent; CC; DNA sample and surcharge; DV surcharge; probation review hearings; I/S 30 days MCJ for rule violations; and I/S 20 hours CS for rule violations.

NEXT DATES >>
Probation Review Hearing: 9/16/22 at 1:15p.m.

Adj: 3:32p.m.

Review hearing on July 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on July 21, 2022 at 02:50 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on July 25, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Jury status hearing on September 13, 2022 at 01:50 pm.
Jury Trial on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): A.J.B.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's  residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Defendant shall not possess or use any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 2:19 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Alex Lech for ADA Molly Lawrence. Defendant appears from MCJ via Zoom, with Atty Paige Metzman, in person.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved.

COURT ORDERS: $500.00 cash bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): A.J.B.
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- No possession or use of firearms or dangerous weapons. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

DATES:
RH: 7/20/22 @ 1:00 p.m. Courtroom B.
PH:  7/25/22 @ 9:10 a.m. Courtroom B.
JPTC: 7/21/22 @ 2:50 p.m. 
JSH: 9/13/22 @ 1:50 p.m. 
JT: 10/20/22 @ 9:00 a.m.
Branch 6.

Deft Phone: 715-803-0902.

Adjourned: 2:24 p.m.
